Posts.Content: I'm so sorry for your loss. Sending love and hugs your way.  Xxx
Posts.Title: Fifth day of radiotherapy, and my sister rings me ...

Posts.Content: I have my first Oncology appointment on Wednesday next week, any ideas what to expect and how long it will take? Appointment is st 4.40 late in the day.  I've had surgery for invasive ductal breast cancer stage 2, ER positive and HER2 negative. Tumour was 6cm and they did an axillary clearance as the cancer was there too.  Thanks  Lizzy X
Posts.Title: First Oncology Appointment

Posts.Content: I'm ER positive HER 2 Neg and I have my last chemo tomorrow. I'm having Radiotherapy starting on the 16th Nov. I gather I need hormone treatment??? Any idea what and how long, will I need to have finished Radiotherapy first??  I'm also waiting results of a biopsy they took from a lump on my scarline that they think could be a cyst. Anyone else had this?  Thanks  Lizx
Posts.Title: ER positive, HER2 Neg. Treatment after Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Claire I’m feeling very anxious as I’m more worried about how my husband and are going to cope, I don’t have an family around me.  Good luck for April xxx
Posts.Title: DIEP/TRAM Surgery - what to bring to hospital?

Posts.Content: I’m having either TRAM/DIEP Surgery in a couple of weeks time. Surgeon will decide he said when he operates. Since I was given my surgery date I’ve been very anxious.  Any advice on what to bring with to hospital or not to?  Do I need to bring my own bras because when I had my mastectomy I was fitted with one at the hospital?  Thanks
Posts.Title: DIEP/TRAM Surgery - what to bring to hospital?

Posts.Content: Thanks Moresleep, will will look online at M&S and House of Fraser. Will also invest in support knickers.
Posts.Title: DIEP/TRAM Surgery - what to bring to hospital?

Posts.Content: Hi Ruby Rose. I’ve had my pre assessment and was just told if I needed to bring anything with I would be sent this with my admissions letter, that says nothing other than when surgery is and where to go with a booklet about having surgery that is very general.  I think I will give my plastics breast nurse a call and take it from there.  I’ve been waiting for this procedure for nearly a year, waiting list are extremely long.  Good luck with your scan and hope you get a date very soon. X
Posts.Title: DIEP/TRAM Surgery - what to bring to hospital?

Posts.Content: Thanks Nutmeg56, going shopping next week to look for Pj’s with buttons. Will get Hubby to bring cushions when he fetched me xxx
Posts.Title: DIEP/TRAM Surgery - what to bring to hospital?

Posts.Content: I was told my cancer was 'slow growing ' but my tumour was 131mm and in my Lymph nodes. I had a mammogram 18 months before that was said to be clear at the time?? I've have this guilt that I could have done better with looking after my health. I've had a totally of 5 mammograms with detection on the last one.  This cancer has taken its toll on me and I'm still suffering side effects, waiting for referrals etc to help....  Lizx
Posts.Title: Copy of notes

Posts.Content: Can any one advise me on how I go about get a copy of my NHS Notes and a digital copy of my Ultrasounds and Mammograms? I have been treated under two different Trusts. I spoke to my Oncologists secretary a week ago and she said she would speak to him and if it was okay put a copy of a specific report  in the post to me that I had concern about.  I asked if there was a problem to get back to me, and so far nothing has arrived in the post or any come back.  Thanks  Liz  xxx
Posts.Title: Copy of notes

Posts.Content: Hi Julia,  I have been copied into everything up until my last letter, I had to ask for a copy as I never received it. The Dr wrote something in the letter (second opinion) that I would like a copy of. I have been asking 7 months for this second opinion as I believe my cancer has been around much longer but was missed. I have had to ask at just about every appointment if he had got this opinion and was even told that it wouldn't make a difference to my treatment now??  His letter implied that the cancer was there but small from the opinion from the second DR. This is the report that I would like to read myself. Lizxxx
Posts.Title: Copy of notes

Posts.Content: Good luck for the 21st Clare, let us know how it goes? I've been told it's a very long waiting list when I get put on it.  Liz xxx
Posts.Title: Angiogram

Posts.Content: I've been waiting over a month for an Angiogram to check blood supply as I'm planning on having the DIEP Reconstruction done. I called the hospital and it's been booked for two weeks time and was told letter is in the post.  Will I be able to drive afterwards as I don't have help getting there and back to the hospital?  I'm also on the Add Asprin trial, would I have to stop this for the procedure to be done?  Many Thanks  Liz
Posts.Title: Angiogram

Posts.Content: Thanks for your replies, I can drive home afterwards. They said I will just have to stay about half an hour after the Angiogram to get my blood treasure checked.  Lizxxx
Posts.Title: Angiogram

Posts.Content: I'm cold capping but does anyone know any fantastic sites for scarves or turbins to order online and any good tutorials. I left the chemo unit with hair full of condition and thought if I had a lovely s scarf I could have used it.  Many thanks Lizzy
Posts.Title: Head scarf/turbin

Posts.Content: I’ve been on Tamoxifen for 10 months and have awful side effects. The worst being joint pains, so bad that I can hardly move at times. My oncologist said to stop the Tamoxifen for 6 weeks and see if there is a difference. She not sure if it’s still problems from the Chemo - FEC-T that I finished a year ago today. I am stiff when I wake up, then once I get moving it eases off but then if I’ve been on my feet longer than an hour it get worse and worse. My daughter said to me the other day she has not seen a day go past that she’s not seen me limping. Im also experiencing the most awful hot flushes that I get no sleep and I’m exhausted all the time, have itching when I have these flushes. Etc  What is worrying me is is there an alternative to the Tamoxifen, friends are saying I’m mad for even coming off it for 6 weeks?  Here is a little of my History.  G1 DCIS Tumour  T3 - 140mm  Nodes 8/18 positive  ER8 HER2 neg Had FEC-T and Radiotherapy after my mastectomy.  What would you all advise?
Posts.Title: Is there an alternative to Tamoxifen?
